title: Japanese scientists produce viable oocytes from only male cells
description: This research opens new perspectives and possibilities for fertility research and reproductive biology.

title: Wall Street banks deposit $30 billion to rescue First Republic
description: The move marks a dramatic initiative by the lenders to bolster the system and ease concerns of regional bank failures.

title: Notre-Dame Cathedral, the pioneer of the 'iron ladies'
description: The metal staples used to secure the stones and revealed by the April 2019 fire were not actually from a renovation. These original pieces represent the earliest massive use of iron in a Gothic monument.

title: Cyclone Freddy death toll dramatically rises in Malawi
description: After four days of destructive wind and rain, this deadly storm has killed hundreds, displaced tens of thousands of others across Malawi and Mozambique and may still cause further damage.

title: Poland plans to send first fighter jets to Ukraine 'in next few days'
description: Polish President Duda announced his country would be the first NATO country to give MiG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine.

title: US pregnancy deaths dropped in 2022, after Covid-related spike
description: New figures released say there were officially 733 deaths in pregnancy in the US in 2022, though the final figure is expected to rise.

title: EU finally adopts space defense strategy
description: The European Commission and the European External Action Service unveiled last week a first roadmap toward greater responsibility for security in space.

title: 'Borne to be dead': The slogans of the protests against the French pension reform
description: The large-scale labor movement features chants and posters both targeting particular politicians and highlighting the impact of the proposed reform, particularly on the working class.

title: French pension reform: Angry protesters assemble in Paris after government bypasses vote
description: French President Emmanuel Macron shunned parliament on Thursday and opted to push through a highly unpopular bill that would raise the retirement age from 62 to 64 by triggering Article 49.3, a special clause in the French Constitution.

title: California battered by one weather disaster after another
description: The most populous state in the United States was still experiencing severe drought in December. It has been hit by a series of atmospheric rivers causing several fatalities and very significant damage.

title: Barbados Prime Minister Mia Mottley makes Global South's concerns heard in the North
description: 'The disparity between a handful of developed countries and the rest of the world is simply too shocking,' said the leader, whose name is being floated to succeed Antonio Guterres as UN secretary-general.

title: Macron opts to force pension bill through Assemblée with no vote
description: The French government will use a controversial constitutional procedure to bypass a vote in the lower house of Parliament.

title: ECB raises rates as planned despite banking turmoil
description: The European Central Bank raised its main interest rates by 0.5% as it had previously pledged to do.

title: France's Centre Pompidou plants roots in Saudi Arabia and expands in South Korea
description: The Centre Pompidou has just signed a cultural engineering contract with the Al-Ula site in northwestern Saudi Arabia and aims to develop its brand in Seoul.

title: United Kingdom's new budget aims to put British back to work
description: After the financial storm of September 2022, British authorities presented several measures on Wednesday, March 16 to bring the country out of stagnation.

title: Napoli-Frankfurt Champions League violence sparks political controversy in Italy
description: On the sidelines of the round of 16 second leg, German fans violently clashed with the police in the Italian city.

title: Strikes, protests and clashes over deadly Greek rail crash
description: During a brief flare-up of violence, protesters hurled gasoline bombs at a police cordon and riot police responded with tear gas and sound grenades.

title: Football: Infantino re-elected to head FIFA until 2027
description: Gianni Infantino, the only candidate in the running, was re-elected by acclamation to lead world football's governing body.

title: French pension reform: Unions stay put despite protests losing steam
description: Unions intend to keep fighting the proposed reform even though demonstrations and strikes are losing momentum.

title: As garbage piles up, Paris police moves to force collectors back to work
description: Garbage collectors in Paris are striking against the government's pension reform raising the retirement age. But the

title: Credit Suisse's woes bring pressure on French and European banks
description: In the wake of Credit Suisse, shares in Europe's major banks fell again on Wednesday, two days after a drop caused by the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank in the US.

title: French pension reform: Anxious government braces for moment of truth
description: A joint committee between the two chambers of Parliament agreed on a final draft of the bill on Wednesday. But the final vote on Thursday at the Assemblée Nationale could go either way.

title: Swiss regulators try to quell stock market panic after Credit Suisse plummets
description: Switzerland's-largest bank lost nearly a quarter of its market capitalization on Wednesday, reviving the specter of the 2008 global financial crisis.

title: France's proposed pension reform faces crucial parliamentary vote
description: On Thursday, Emmanuel Macron faces a 'moment of truth' ahead of a vote that could be a turning point for his second term in office.

title: Austria's economy remains tied to Russia
description: The country still imports the vast majority of its gas from Russia. The Austrian business sector's reluctance to break with Moscow has met little political criticism.

title: Three's a crowd for Germany's Scholz, who faces coalition contradictions
description: Torn between his party's position and those of the Greens and the Liberals (FDP), the Social Democrat chancellor is struggling to set a clear course for his policy.

title: French pension reform: On the eve of the vote, demonstrators oscilate between rage and resignation
description: On Wednesday, during the eighth day of protests, there were fewer demonstrators, with the bill arriving at the Sénat and Assemblée Nationale on Thursday for the formal vote.

title: Egypt's military economic empire under threat
description: Amidst a proposed privitization plan from the Egyptian government, the generals are reluctant to give up shares in the companies they control.

title: Israel: Proposed compromise on judicial reform promptly rejected by Netanyahu
description: Isaac Herzog, the country's figurehead president, unveiled the proposal after more than two months of mass protests against Netanyahu’s plan to overhaul the country's legal system.

title: Two and a half tons of uranium are missing from a site in Libya
description: UN nuclear agency chief Rafael Grossi said that inspectors on Tuesday found that 10 drums containing uranium ore concentrate 'were not present as previously declared' at the location in Libya.
